subject: Re: [junit] Re: detect test failure in teardown()

messageBody:
Hi,

> TestResult tr = new TestResult();
This can only yield wrong results, as you create a new TestResult rather
than using the one JUnit uses.

You can just overwrite the runBare method in TestCase, like this:


import junit.framework.*;

public class fail extends TestCase {
public void runBare() throws Throwable {
setUp();
runTest();
tearDown();
}

public void tearDown() {
System.out.println("down");
}

public void testWorks() {
// Nothing works always ;-)
}

public void testFails() {
fail("did not work");
}

public void testThrows() {
throw new RuntimeException("woops");
}
}


Running this, I get
